notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Many pages are lightly damaged and/or worm-eaten.
Folio 88v contains rules relating to shehitah in the form of question and answer, probably of 17th century.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A short midrash on the Pentateuch, in Hebrew and Arabic.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Black buckram, blind-tooled. Spine title: 'Midrash on Pentateuch. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1481.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 24 November 1877: inscribed, folio [98v].
